What's more beautiful than nature in bloom? ğŸŒ¸ Sometimes I wish spring lasted all year, but I quickly snap out of it. There's so much beauty in diversity! I love all four seasons and seeing them transform the world around me just makes me appreciate the whole cycle of life more. That's how I feel about all of humanity. We should embrace our differences and use them to bring us together rather than divide us. Here's to a world that tolerates, no, *celebrates* diversity! ğŸŒ â€¢â€¢â€¢ TELL ME: Do you have a favourite season? After living in Scotland, England and Russia I've really come to appreciate sunshine, but I was born in October so I'll always be a fall baby at heart ğŸğŸ‚

The way you look at the world changes everything ğŸ‘€ If you're seeing everything around you through a lens of fear and mistrust that's exactly what you'll find. But if you choose to focus on the good and find beauty where most people don't notice it, your life will quickly improve! ğŸ’• All this is not to say that being positive is easy. Oftentimes it's not. But it's definitely worth it! â€¢â€¢â€¢ TELL ME: How do you stay positive in a world so full of hate? Earlier today I watched a video of an older man being violently dragged off a flight he'd paid for - I'm sure you've seen it too by now. It broke my heart to see a human being treated so poorly! What do you do in those moments to remind yourself that *most* people are kind? ğŸ’”ğŸ•Š

Much like Barcelona has Antoni GaudÃ­, Vienna's architecture was shaped by another architectural mastermind - Friedensreich Regentag Dunkelbunt Hundertwasser. No, Iâ€™ve not just put an ancient Germanic curse on you, that's really his name ğŸ˜‚â¤ Hundertwasser's houses are full of vibrant colours, innovative textures and lush greenery. I love how he managed to incorporate nature into his designs! What do you think about his style? It's definitely out there but I'm a fan ğŸ¤“ â€¢â€¢â€¢ TELL ME: Do you have a favourite architect or beautiful building? ğŸ›

We need to talk! I love Instagramming my travels but I've been feeling a little discouraged lately... ğŸ™ˆ Not because of how many likes or followers I have or anything like that. I'm grateful for every single one of you and don't take your support for granted! â¤ I'm feeling discouraged because I see a lot of half truths on social media. As photographers we want to make the world around us look beautiful, but how much is *too* much? Is it ok to edit the colour of the sky? How about the colour of your eyes? What about removing people from your image and making it look like you were the only person there? ğŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸ I don't have the answers but think this is a conversation we need to have. Take this photo for example... I've photoshopped two images together, but would you know that if I didn't tell you? Probably not because we take what we see on social media for granted, despite knowing that a lot of manipulation goes on behind the scenes. How much can we *really* trust the travel photos we see on @instagram? I'd LOVE to hear your take on this - please join the debate and share your opinion! ğŸ¤“
